rp.warehouse.pc.localisation

Class Ranges

  • java.lang.Object
    • rp.warehouse.pc.localisation.Ranges

  • public class Ranges
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to store the ranges from all directions. Used in partnership with a location-oriented class such as Point or Location.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte DOWN 
      static byte LEFT 
      static RangeConverter physicalConverter 
      static byte RIGHT 
      static byte UP 
      static RangeConverter virtualConverter 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ranges(boolean up, boolean right, boolean down, boolean left)
      Create an instance of Ranges given the up, right, down and left ranges to be stored, using pre-converted values.
      Ranges(float up, float right, float down, float left, RangeConverter converter)
      Create an instance of Ranges given the up, right, down and left ranges to be stored, converting real world or virtual world distances.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ranges

        public Ranges(float up,
              float right,
              float down,
              float left,
              RangeConverter converter)
        Create an instance of Ranges given the up, right, down and left ranges to be stored, converting real world or virtual world distances.
        Parameters:
        up - The range upward relative to the current position.
        right - The range right relative to the current position.
        down - The range downward relative to the current position.
        left - The range left relative to the current position.

      • Ranges

        public Ranges(boolean up,
              boolean right,
              boolean down,
              boolean left)
        Create an instance of Ranges given the up, right, down and left ranges to be stored, using pre-converted values.
        Parameters:
        up - pre-converted north/up range.
        right - pre-converted east/right range.
        down - pre-converted south/down range.
        left - pre-converter west/left range.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public boolean get(byte direction)
        Method to get a stored range in a given direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction of which to return the range.
        Returns:
        The range in the given direction.

      • set

        public void set(byte direction,
                boolean value)
        Method to update the value for a specific direction of a range.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction to update.
        value - the value to change to.

      • getAvailableDirections

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Byte> getAvailableDirections()
        Method to get a list of available directions to travel in given the ranges.
        Returns:
        The directions of which can be travelled without collisions.

      • rotate

        public static Ranges rotate(Ranges ranges,
                            int rot)
        Method to rotate the ranges by a given angle.
        Parameters:
        ranges - The ranges to rotate.
        rot - The angle of rotation.
        0 = 0
        1 = 90
        2 = 180
        3 = 270
        Returns:
        The rotated version of the ranges.

      • getOpposite

        public static byte getOpposite(byte direction)
        Get the opposite direction from the given one.
        Parameters:
        direction - the opposite direction to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the opposite direction from the one given.

      • fromArray

        public static Ranges fromArray(float[] array,
                               RangeConverter converter)
        Create a Ranges object from an array of ranges and a range converter.
        Parameters:
        array - the values to use.
        converter - the converter to use.
        Returns:
        the Ranges object made from the values.
